item.title: Kodak Alaris unveils new wireless scanners with network connectivity
item.description:
Kodak Alaris’ latest desktop scanners, the Kodak ScanMate i1150WN and Kodak i1190WN, offer wireless and network connectivity and are compatible with mobile apps. These features support bring-your-own-device (BYOD) policies and workplace mobility. Source: Kodak Alaris. TheÂ Kodak ScanMate i1150WN. The i1150WN and i1190WN scanners can connect through an office network or Wi-Fi, making them adaptable to various office settings. Standard drivers (TWAIN, ISIS) allow integration with new and existing business applications, streamlining the capture process and simplifying software installation...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/kodak-alaris-unveils-new-wireless-scanners-with-network-connectivity/

item.title: KODAK CapturePro Software v5.0 has been released by Kodak Alaris
item.description:
Large businesses are constantly looking for ways to manage information more efficiently and productively. Extracting data from documents for business processes and getting information into digital storage can slow things down, impacting expenses and customer happiness. Source: Kodak Alaris. “As organizations rely more on online platforms for profit, it’s critical to manage remaining paper documents effectively,” says Harvey Spencer, President of leading capture software analyst firm Harvey Spencer Associates. “The best approach is quickly converting paper into usable electronic data...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/kodak-capturepro-software-v5-0-has-been-released-by-kodak-alaris/
